intro: Eriocaulon nepalense var. nepalense, commonly known as the Nepal spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
